job.title: Business Operations Manager
job.description:
About Kraken

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade, Kraken has risen to become one of the largest, most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet. 

We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank, providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter. 

Our diverse group of 2,000+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture, united by a shared passion for delighting customers, upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve, are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential. 

Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and we’re just getting started. We’re growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution!

About the Role

This is a fully remote role. 

Given our explosive growth and the incredible opportunity in front of us, we are working to innovate across all aspects of the company and execute on our highly ambitious plans.

The Business Operations team works closely with all functional areas of the company to improve Kraken’s effectiveness and efficiency. The team acts as a thought partner to leadership across the company, helping them understand and improve operational processes.  

On a daily basis, the team delivers actionable data-driven insights and recommendations that helps the company stay organized and coordinated. 

Responsibilities
  • Lead the execution of high-impact, cross-functional projects
  • Establish partnerships across functions, gaining a deep understanding of their operating models and identifying opportunities for innovation and improvement 
  • Bring workflow management and automation tools to bear in order to improve process infrastructure for scaling and performance
  • Establish strong working relationships across functions and management levels, working collaboratively and independently to drive improvement 
  • Bring stellar analytical methods to complex challenges around scale, operating models and cross-functional processes
  • Own initial delivery of recommendations, demonstrating proof-of-concepts and real business outcomes while spurring change 
  • Cultivate a deep understanding of what makes Kraken tick and readily identify and address potential blockers to progress
  • Mentor team members and drive continuous improvement of our team’s ways of working

    • Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 5+ years experience in a similar role
  • Proactive communicator with excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
  • Passion for solving complex problems and building scalable processes
  • Creativity, adaptability, tenacity, a sense of urgency, and a hands-on, roll-up your sleeves work ethic
  • Strong interest in and familiarity with both cryptocurrency and traditional financial industries
  • Experience and proven track record in business process management consulting or operations roles in the financial services or technology industries
  • Experience navigating complex operational hurdles in hyper-growth companies
    • Location Tagging: #EU #US #CANADA #LI-Remote

    We’re powered by people from around the world with their own unique and diverse experiences. We value all Krakenites and their talents, contributions, and perspectives, regardless of their background. 

    As an equal opportunity employer we don’t tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Whether that’s based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws. 

    Check out all our open roles at https://www.kraken.com/careers.

job.title: Senior UX Designer
job.description:
About Wintermute
 
Wintermute is a hyper-growth fintech startup and one of the largest players in the global digital asset markets. We provide liquidity algorithmically across most cryptocurrency exchanges and trading platforms, as well as support high profile blockchain projects and traditional financial institutions moving into crypto.

Culturally, we combine the best traits of both trading companies and technology startups. As a trading company, we manage hundreds of millions in assets, trade more than $5B+/day across dozens of trading platforms and are highly profitable in doing so. As a technology startup, we build, innovate and move incredibly fast, we create best-in-class liquidity products that create more efficient markets. We believe that traditional finance has to change and we are on a mission to define and build the decentralized future of finance. 

Wintermute is a hyper-growth highly profitable proprietary trading business. We are backed by top tier global venture capital investors such as Lightspeed, Pantera Capital, Sino Global Capital, Blockchain.com Ventures, Avon Ventures by Fidelity Investments, DeFi Alliance and others. Learn more about our team and culture on our website and Evgeny’s post here.


Working at Wintermute

In this role you will be driving user experience vision and execution for Wintermute’s B2B and prosumer products. You are someone who can take initiative and lead, and also loves to design. You have the big picture in mind, but also impeccable attention to detail. You’ll work alongside our very talented product managers, visual designers, engineers and traders. You will improve experience of the existing products and design new ones from scratch. You will keep learning about the dynamic space that crypto is, closely interact with the industry and the users, and enjoy being at the heart of the evolving blockchain space.

Responsibilities
  • Experience Strategy and Delivery
  • Develop user experience vision and make it a reality
  • Co-own design projects with visual design and execute on UX end-to-end, incl discovery, concept, prototypes, detailed designs and ongoing refinement.
  • Develop design system in partnership with visual design 

  • Market & User Insights
  • Conduct user research, from early discovery to user testing
  • Conduct market research to adopt industry best practice, while developing competitive edge
  • Utilise quantitative data to evaluate and steer design strategy

  • Collaboration
  • Work closely with visual designers, product managers and developers to deliver holistic experience for users
  • Embed design thinking approach to drive user-centric problem solving

  • Other
  • Most Importantly, all employees can shape and develop their roles. There's no limit set by the company.

    • Hard Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree in UX / HCI or equivalent
  • 5+ years experience as a UX designer working with complex financial products in B2B / prosumer space, and a corresponding portfolio
  • Passion for complex products and hard-to-crack problems
  • Experience designing holistic product frameworks, establishing design systems and principles, create product blueprints
  • Strong personal interest and experience in crypto
  • Desire to both lead the vision and be very hands-on with execution

    • Preferred Requirements
  • Experienced Figma user
  • Experience with varied research techniques
  • Data analytics skills, with visualisation tools or Python

    • Wintermute offer
  • A unique opportunity to work on very interesting projects, get the level of responsibility and ownership that would be unlikely at any other firm
  • Great company culture: informal, non-hierarchical, ambitious, highly professional yet collaborative and entrepreneurial 
  • A cool office in central London with a sci-fi touch
  • We support significant flexibility in regards to working from home and working hours; however, we require hard/smart work and >60% work from the office; we are unable to accept remote candidates
  • Weekly team events, such as team lunches, team dinners, team board games and Dota playing sessions; these are not obligatory in any sense, but this is what we like to do
  • Aligned incentive structure: on top of competitive pay, a significant part of your compensation is performance-based variable pay with unlimited upside
  • We offer standard perks too, like pension, private health insurance, free food and office gym, but that’s probably not the right reason to join us
  • We offer UK work permits and help in relocation

    • Write to us if
  • You love problem solving, and love seeing your products work
  • You are determined, ambitious yet humble, willing to work hard and learn on the way
  • You like meritocracy and being judged by what you deliver
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset versus 9-to-5 mentality
  • You are prepared to work non-standard working hours (since we are a high-growth startup operating in the 24/7 crypto world)
  • You like working in the team environment (not fully remote)

    • Tips for a successful application
  • This is a London based role
  • Do some research: look at our website and social media channels
  • If you don't have an obviously matching experience or skills, make sure you state very clearly what you can bring or how your experience is relevant.
  • Prepare to be tested on your hard skills required for this job. We do not care as much about your credentials (university or prior employer), but we care a lot about your knowledge and ability to get things done.
  • Unfortunately, we won't be able to proceed if you simply press "submit button"; we do promise to reply to everyone who puts time and effort in making the application relevant!

job.title: Cardano DCF Content Editor
job.description:
Cardano is an open source blockchain project committed to a roadmap towards decentralized governance. As part of this journey, IO Global is looking for a Content Editor to help drive forward our Decentralized Consortium Funding program, an exciting new model to expand the developer base for Cardano’s protocol and ecosystem development.

In 2021, Cardano has achieved incredible success, but we are still early in this space and have a long way to go. A big component of the continued evolution of Cardano is IO Global’s efforts to fully open source and decentralize the core development of the platform and protocol. To do this, we will need to build a broad coalition and a consortium of highly qualified and reputable firms that can meaningfully contribute to this effort.

As a Content Editor at IOG, you are responsible for creating, maintaining, and assessing the quality of technical documentation, working directly with product teams and SMEs to develop an understanding of specialized subject matter. As part of the Cardano DCF marketing and communications team, you are also expected to contribute to general copywriting and content work and to function as a technical intermediary, providing digestible summaries of complex topics to enable and support the broader communications team function.

Your mission

  • Work with developer teams and subject matter experts to capture core Cardano DCF information and turn it into clear, digestible user information
  • Publish articles across IOG social media channels (LinkedIn, IOHK Blog, Medium) to make Cardano DCF approachable
  • Publish content to showcase consortium members and highlight what unique capabilities they bring to the Cardano DCF and the development of the Cardano platform, protocol, and ecosystem as a whole
  • Update existing content, and write new content about our technology, our products and our people and how the Cardano DCF helps our ecosystem evolve
  • Proofread, review and organize all technical documentation by liaising with the product managers and technical team
  • Create Content for Cardano DCF for different formats: Turn Cardano platform & protocol development into blog posts and web content
  • Produce high caliber documents that meet our standards and guidelines so that we maintain a common look and feel to all articles published
  • Communicate and collaborate with team members, including members of the communication team, through information gathering, content reviews, meetings, and status reports.

Your expertise

  • Minimum of 1-3 years of experience as a Technical Writer preferably with a technology company
  • Thorough knowledge of editorial journalism concepts and techniques
  • Solid experience working directly with developer and SMEs
  • Attention to detail
  • Critical thinking skills
  • Ability to work independently and under pressure created by deadlines
  • University degree majoring in communications and/or journalism.

Location

IOG is a fully distributed organization and therefore this is a remote position. Due to team distribution we are ideally searching for someone in a Central European or Pacific Standard time zone.

All Colleagues

  • Flexible schedule
  • Remote work - ability to work anywhere
  • Laptop reimbursement
  • New starter package to buy hardware essentials (headphones, monitor, etc)
  • Learning & Development opportunities
  • Competitive PTO and Sick Leave plan

US Employees

  • Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits coverage through Anthem with 100% premium cost covered by IO Global for the employee and dependents
  • Health Savings Account
  • Life Insurance

UK Employees

  • Monthly Health Stipend to use towards any wellness or medical coverage/service
  • Pension

job.title: Go to Market Manager - Freelance
job.description:
SettleMint eliminates complexity in Enterprise blockchain development, deployment and integration. Our low-code Blockchain Platform as a Service (BPaaS) is recognised by Gartner and Everest Group as a leading technological solution for blockchain application development globally. Using our BPaaS solution enables our customers, to rapidly integrate blockchain into their digital transformation projects, to rapidly move from a blockchain concept to a fully integrated solution.

About SettleMint organisation and team:
SettleMint has offices in Belgium, UAE, India and Singapore. A culturally diverse team with deep industry experience in developing innovative and scalable blockchain developer tools. The team includes industry leading thinkers and doers who strive to extend SettleMint’s product leadership, bound together by the ambition to accelerate blockchain adoption globally. In addition to our in-house team, we work hand-in-hand with leading systems integrators active in the blockchain space to deliver end-to-end solutions to customers. We are currently a team of over 50 and are growing our engineering, solution architecture, client success and sales teams.

What’s the opportunity?

One of SettleMint’s flagship products is Databroker.global, a blockchain-supported decentralized data marketplace where buyers and sellers exchange data on a peer-to-peer basis. The data exchanged are put to use towards improving operational efficiencies, capturing new markets, and driving better decision making across industries and the public sector.

We are looking for an innovative, detail-oriented Go To Market Manager with strong business acumen for a 5-month mission where you will be leading the go-to-market of a data marketplace for the IOT sector.

In this pivotal role, you will be reporting directly to the head of marketing and become a key member of the project team. Your mission will be to take ownership and be responsible for the set up and the execution of the platform strategy, which includes the design and management of online and social campaigns, the set up of an industry segmentation, the development of customer personas and the orchestration of content marketing campaigns. Also, the monitoring and reporting of the campaign, the identification and resolution of issues, as well as adhering to contract specifications will be part of your responsibilities.

To be successful in this role, you should be an experienced and versatile project manager with excellent technical skills and sound knowledge of growth hacking techniques, as well as strong interpersonal and communication skills.


Requirements:

  • 3-5 years minimum experience in digital project management, with an expertise in go-to-market strategies, preferably in a start up environment where you had to make it happen.

  • An analytical mindset, you are comfortable working with Google Analytics or other reporting tools. You know what a market segmentation is and you are able to connect qualitative and quantitative data analysis and link them into a go-to-market strategy.

  • Tech savvy with a knowledge of growth hacking and SEO tools (Phantombuster, Sales Navigator, Lusha, Semrush…) ideally experienced with an integrated solution like Hubspot (another one is also ok).

  • Able to work independently or as part of a team and you have a high sense of ownership.

  • The ability to dream big but realize that achieving great goals often requires small operational steps that you will be happy to undertake.

  • Motivated to train yourself and curious to learn, you are eager to engage in a learning path where you will be continuously auto-challenging yourself, taking lessons from successes and failures.

  • You are proficient in Word, PowerPoint and at least one CMS platform that you have used extensively in the past. Familiarity with Hubspot is a plus, but not absolutely required.

  • An international experience in Africa is a plus.

  • Interest for new technologies in general and Blockchain in particular is definitely an asset.


Language:

Fluent (spoken and written) in English plus one other European language.

Employment Terms:

  • Freelancer for 2 to 3 days a week based in Belgium

  • Potential start early February 2022

  • 5 months contract to start with, potential to extend beyond if needed.

  • Remote to start, reporting to Belgium HQ


STRICTLY NO AGENCIES

job.title: Partner Manager
job.description:
About Rarible
Rarible is one of the largest decentralized, creator-centric multi chain NFT marketplaces for multimedia content, including but not limited to digital art, collectibles, music, videos, and more. Rarible offers a user-friendly, community-led experience for creators and collectors to come together.

Rarible has an extremely active community of followers, creators, curators and collectors who are actively shaping the future of our marketplace and the evolution of digital ownership in web 3.0. 

Rarible has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to learn and grow every day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. We’d love for you to join our growing team!

The Role
  • Rarible is looking for an NFT enthusiast to help partners make the most of the space, whether it is taking their first steps and/or building long term NFT strategies. Reporting directly to the Chief Business Development Officer, this role will have a US focus, with success based on the attraction and retention of great NFT creators and projects to the Platform.

    • Key responsibilities
  • Build and foster strong relationships with NFT Creators and projects.
  • Help make sure that drops run smoothly and successfully
  • Handle inbound requests in an organised and timely fashion
  • Handle partner account issue including problem solving, on-boarding guidance and day-to-day inbound from partners.
  • Track, analyze and communicate industry trends.
  • Create innovative and strategic programs that ladder up to company goals.

    • Skills & Qualifications
  • Strong knowledge and passion for the space.
  • Ability to work with partners on technical details, diagnosing problems and finding solutions
  • Proven track record in partner management
  • Self-motivated and experienced operating in a rapidly changing work environment and remain productive with minimal supervision
  • Proactive solution-oriented team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Effective presentation, written and verbal communication skills.
  • English required, Spanish and Russian a bonus
  • Ability to succeed in a global, remote environment, working cross-company successfully to drive results.
  • Ability to travel regionally and globally periodically
    • What do we offer
    📍 Working for a rapidly expanding global organization
    📍 Mentorship, training and career progression plans with leadership focused on developing the teams
    📍 Team that cares about products and working conditions
    📍 Flexible hours
    📍 Full-time, paid vacations 
    📍 Remote first with relocation packages available

    📍 Attractive packages with bonus programme, plus healthcare and dental benefits and 401K (country dependent)
